text.div:
Root Cause

Code Description Comment Version
AP Analysis Process Enter (AP) when ANALYSIS PROCESS is the reason due to: • Product or supply failure (reagents, calibrators, QC material) • Equipment or instrumentation failure added v2.8
IM Information Management Enter (IM) when INFORMATION MANAGEMENT is the reason due to: • Database or Programming issues • Overriding of test results • Inaccurate calculations • Inaccurate flagging, reference ranges, units of measure • Incomplete/inaccurate transmission of test results • Other added v2.8
L Laboratory Enter (L) when LABORATORY is the reason due to: â¢ Data Entry error â¢ Testing/Technical error â¢ Repeat testing causing change to test result added v2.8
NA Not Applicable Enter (NA) when NOT-APPLICABLE is the reason due to: • If no revisions performed or • unable to determine reason for revision Note: Do not use NA if result code status is not corrected (revised) or if a preliminary release of results with a correction (revision) added v2.8
PD Placer Data Enter (PD) when new or changed PLACER DATA information is the reason due to: • Changed patient demographics or • Result code data provided by the client on the requisition or specimen manifest that will be entered during order entry (i.e. Previous Biopsy Date, Clinical Information, Source, etc...) added v2.8

name: v2.0914
title: v2 Root Cause
description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0914 ( Root Cause)
